item.title: About
item.description: Paul Ohm is a Professor of Law at the Georgetown University Law Center in Washington, D.C. Professor Ohm tries to build bridges between computer science and law in his research, service, and teaching, building on his training as a lawyer, computer programmer, and network systems admininstrator.

item.title: Contact
item.description: ohm@law.georgetown.edu 202-662-9685 Paul Ohm 600 New Jersey Avenue, N.W. Washington, D.C. 20001

All Courses Taught Computer Crime (Lecture and Seminar); Computer Programming for Lawyers (Introductory and Intermediate); Copyright; Criminal Justice; Criminal Procedure, Investigative; Information Privacy (Lecture and Seminar); Introduction to Intellectual Property; Investigating Crime in the Darknet; LL.M Academic Legal Writing Seminar; Technology of Privacy; Quantitative Methods for Lawyers
